DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Tumor T Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary breast carcinoma based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the clinical T stage for a breast tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.longName: Breast
Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/17/17 tt associated with CS/CSI. 9/13/17 tt transferred context; changed def - 1st letter upper case; changed Reg Status to Qualified.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 T Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer meeting the clinical-pathologic criteria of inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4d TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer meeting the clinical-pathologic criteria of inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with extension to the chest wall, not including the pectoralis muscle, and with edema (including peau d'orange) or ulceration of the skin of the breast of satellite skin nodules confined to the same breast. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4c TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with extension to the chest wall, not including the pectoralis muscle, and with edema (including peau d'orange) or ulceration of the skin of the breast or satellite skin nodules confined to the same breast. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with ulceration and/or ipsilateral satellite nodules and/or edema (including peau d'orange) of the skin, which do not meet the criteria for inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with ulceration and/or ipsilateral satellite nodules and/or edema (including peau d'orange) of the skin, which do not meet the criteria for inflammatory carcinoma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with extension to the chest wall, not including the pectoralis muscle. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with extension to the chest wall, not including the pectoralis muscle. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor of any size with direct extension to chest wall or skin, but only as described in pT4 sub-categories, in accordance with TNM guidelines. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT4 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor of any size with direct extension to chest wall or skin, but only as described in pT4 sub-categories, in accordance with TNM guidelines. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 2.0 cm, but not more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT2 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 2.0 cm, but not more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 1.0 cm, but not more than 2.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1c TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 1.0 cm, but not more than 2.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 0.5 cm, but not more than 1.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1b TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 0.5 cm, but not more than 1.0 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc  3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 0.1 cm, but not more than 0.5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1a TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size more than 0.1 cm, but not more than 0.5 cm in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition.  mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size 0.1 cm or less in greatest dimension (microinvasion). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1mic TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size 0.1 cm or less in greatest dimension (microinvasion). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with tumor size 2.0 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT1 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with tumor size 2.0 cm or less in greatest dimension. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pTis Paget TNM Finding

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pTis Paget TNM Finding
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Paget disease of the nipple without invasive carcinoma and/or carcinoma in situ in the underlying breast parenchyma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis Paget TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Paget disease of the nipple without invasive carcinoma and/or carcinoma in situ in the underlying breast parenchyma. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with a finding of lobular carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th Ed and 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis (LCIS) TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with a finding of lobular carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with a finding of ductal carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th Ed and 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis (DCIS) TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with a finding of ductal carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated VM with latest version of NCIt concept definition. mc 3/20/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTis TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with a finding of carcinoma in situ. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pT0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with no evidence of primary tumor. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pTX TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which the primary tumor cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)
